intro: Cinchona ovata var. rufinervis, commonly known as the red-veined cinchona, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves, which give it its common name. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pink, and it produces small, red berries that are edible but not widely cultivated for commercial use.
